(Simplified: 驮)
Pictophonetic: 大 indicates the sound; 馬 (horse) conveys the meaning.
  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 馬 [ mǎ ] horse; surname
    • 大 [ dà ] big, great, vast, high, deep
①用揹負載：馱運。馱着兩袋米。
馱運 [ tuó yùn ]: to transport on pack animal; to carry (a load on one's back)
馱簍 [ tuó lǒu ]: pannier; double basket slung across pack animal
馱馬 [ tuó mǎ ]: pack horse
馱獸 [ tuó shòu ]: beast of burden
馱子 [ duò zi ]: pack animal's load
(Simplified: 驮)
Pictophonetic: 大 indicates the sound; 馬 (horse) conveys the meaning.
  • Chinese Definition:
Hanzi: 驮

Main pronunciation 主要发音: tuó

Original meaning 本义: Meaning to carry on the back.

English senses 英语理解: carry on back

Usage example 用法举例: 馱運 tuó yùn (pack)

Shuowen 说文解字: 負物也從馬大聲此俗語也

馱字的基本解释

馱
tuó

馱
duò
均见“驮”。

馱字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuó］
［《廣韻》徒河切，平歌，定。］
［《廣韻》唐佐切，去箇，定。］
“驮1”的繁体字。亦作“駄1”。亦作“1”。
(1)牲口负物。
(2)引申为背负。
(3)指装载。
(4)架。
(5)承受。
(6)叠，一层加上一层。
(7)用同“駝”。参见“馱背”、“馱鳥”。
(8)见“馱馱”。
[②]［duò］
［《廣韻》唐佐切，去箇，定。］
“驮2”的繁体字。亦作“駄2”。亦作“2”。
(1)驮着货物的牲口或指牲口所驮的货物。
(2)量词。

馱字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【馬字部】　馱； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1434第07
【廣韻】徒河切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】唐何切，?音駝。【玉篇】馬負貌。【廣韻】馱，騎也。【李白詩】吳姬十五細馬馱。　又【韻會】或作他。【揚子·方言】凡以驢馬馲駝載物者謂之負他。　又或作佗。【前漢·趙充國傳】以一馬自佗負。【師古註】凡以畜產載負物者，皆謂之佗。　又【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?唐佐切，佗上聲。又【集韻】【五音集韻】?徒蓋切，音大。義?同。　又【集韻】縣名，在江夏。

馱字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tuó］
["Guangyun" Tu Heqi, Ping Ge, Ding. ]
["Guang Yun" Tang Zuoqie, go to Xi, set. ]
Traditional characters for "驮1". Also known as "駄1". Also known as "1".
(1) Livestock bears.
(2) The extension is carrying.
(3) Refers to loading.
(4) Frame.
(5) Accept.
(6) Stack, one layer plus one layer.
(7) Use the same as "camel". See "patchback", "patch bird".
(8) See "tuotuo".
[②]［duò］
["Guang Yun" Tang Zuoqie, go to Xi, set. ]
"驮2" in traditional characters. Also known as "駄2". Also known as "2".
(1) Animals carrying goods or goods carried by animals.
(2) Quantifiers.
Carry
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Haiji 1】【horse character department】　 Tuo; Kangxi strokes: 13; page number: page 1434 to 07
[Guang Yun] Tu He Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Tang He Qi,? Yin camel. [Jade articles] The horse has a negative appearance. [Guang Yun] Carry, ride. 【Li Baishi】Wu Ji fifteen thin horses.　[Yunhui] or be him. [Yangtze Dialect] Those who carry things with donkeys, horses, horses, and camels are said to bear him.　Or as Tuo. [Previous Han·Zhao Chongguo Biography] Lose yourself with one horse. [Shigu's Note] Anyone who uses livestock to carry things is called Tuo.　 [Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun]? Tang Zuoqie, Tuo on the sound. Also 【Jiyun】【Five-tone Jiyun】? Tu Gaiqie, the sound is big. Righteous? Same.　[Jiyun] The name of the county, in Jiangxia.
